body_html: Yes. Empty shared_ptrs should be treated as all-zero tensors. We pre-allocate them for Python functions, so it's easier to implement them for the users, but we should treat them specially in case of C++ functions. We could add a tests that starts backward with None to make sure they don't segfault.
body_text: Yes. Empty shared_ptrs should be treated as all-zero tensors. We pre-allocate them for Python functions, so it's easier to implement them for the users, but we should treat them specially in case of C++ functions. We could add a tests that starts backward with None to make sure they don't segfault.
body: Yes. Empty `shared_ptr`s should be treated as all-zero tensors. We pre-allocate them for Python functions, so it's easier to implement them for the users, but we should treat them specially in case of C++ functions. We could add a tests that starts backward with `None` to make sure they don't segfault.
